title: Apple’s New CO2 Neutral Products Are Cool, But Don’t Let Them Distract You From the Big Picture
summary: Apple has released new carbon-neutral versions of its Apple Watch Series 9, Apple Watch Ultra™ 2, and Apple Watch SE®. The company states these products to be the first-ever carbon-neutral products and aims to have all of its products be carbon neutral by 2030. In addition to transitioning its suppliers to renewable energy sources to reduce emissions, the company has eliminated the use of leather in new Apple Watch bands and cases, opting for a recycled material called FineWoven.
green_innovation: TRUE, the product innovation contributes to environmental sustainability by reducing carbon emissions through the transition to renewable energy sources, reduction of waste, and use of recycled materials.
business_innovation: TRUE, the product innovation meets the criteria of being new or improved compared to previous products and is a significant departure from previous products.
green_product: TRUE, the product innovation meets the criteria of reducing negative environmental externalities by reducing its carbon footprint throughout its lifecycle.
green_process: TRUE, the process innovation meets the criteria of reducing negative environmental externalities by eliminating the use of leather and utilizing a more sustainable material with a lower carbon footprint.
product_or_process: New carbon-neutral Apple Watch Series 9, Apple Watch Ultra™ 2, and Apple Watch SE®.

title: Standardised packaging could save up to 0.8 million tonnes of plastic waste
summary: A new report by sustainable waste management company Biffa highlights significant opportunities to reduce plastic packaging waste in the UK. The report outlines a nine-point plan with achievable timelines for businesses, consumers, and the government. Key interventions include standardization of packaging materials, extension of the Plastic Packaging Tax, and investment in non-mechanical recycling technologies.

title: Amazon replaces plastic air pillows with recycled paper for North American packaging
summary: Amazon is replacing plastic air pillows with recycled paper filler in North American packaging to address environmental concerns. This initiative represents Amazon’s largest plastic packaging reduction effort in North America, avoiding nearly 15 billion plastic air pillows annually. Pat Lindner, VP of Mechatronics and Sustainable Packaging, highlighted the collaboration across Amazon to achieve this goal, emphasizing the focus on using recyclable materials.
likely_naics_codes: ['322212 - Corrugated and Solid Fiber Box Manufacturing', '322213 - Folding Paperboard Box Manufacturing', '322214 - Setup Paperboard Box Manufacturing', '322291 - Coated and Laminated Paper Manufacturing']

title: ‘You are the compass for a sustainable future’
summary: The European Union (EU) is prioritizing the circular economy (CE) in its industrial strategy for the next five years, recognizing the crucial role of recyclers in achieving greater circularity. The EU plans to explore measures such as lower taxes for recycled content in new products, support for chemical recycling as a complement to mechanical recycling, and efforts to retain critical raw materials within the EU.

green_process: TRUE; The article mentions the promotion of green processes, such as chemical recycling and eco-design, as part of the EU's efforts to reduce environmental impacts and promote sustainability.

title: Let’s work together to end plastic pollution
summary: Plastic waste has value, and science and economics now have a way to take plastic waste, break it down into its basic building blocks and turn those building blocks into something useful again. There is immense growth potential in a recycling industry that includes evolved waste management systems, with estimates that current rates of recycling growth could drive $60 to $90B in investments –with about $100B more for collection and sortation—all while creating about one million new jobs. Expanding the use of circular feedstocks from plastic waste will contribute to the industry’s net zero goals by lowering carbon emissions in manufacturing products and packaging by reducing the amount of fossil fuels used in making them.
green_innovation: TRUE, the article describes a new and improved way to recycle plastic waste and turn it into something useful again, which contributes to environmental sustainability goals such as reducing resource consumption by developing a circular economy.
business_innovation: FALSE, the article does not describe a new or improved product or business process that differs significantly from the firm's previous products or business processes.
green_product: TRUE, the article describes a new way to recycle plastic waste and turn it into something useful again, which would be a green product because it is designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, the article describes a new and improved way to recycle plastic waste and turn it into something useful again, which would be a green process because it minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability.

title: Latest Global Carpet Tile and LVT Collections from Interface Explore Crafted Textiles and Natural Forms
summary: Interface, a flooring solutions company, has launched the Etched & Threaded carpet tile and Earthen Forms LVT collections. The Etched & Threaded collection features textured carpet tiles that fit together effortlessly in geometric patterns and neutral hues. The Earthen Forms collection offers LVT products inspired by natural woodgrain and travertine stone, with Ceramor+ ceramic bead coating for enhanced durability and slip resistance.

title: From the SEE Impact Report: Q&A With Timi Fadiran, Ph.D.
summary: SEE (Sustainable Enterprise Enterprises) is committed to circularity in the flexible packaging industry to prevent waste, enable materials recovery, and reduce natural resource use. SEE collaborates with plastic producers and customers, invests in advanced recycling technologies, and participates in industry initiatives like the Alliance to End Plastic Waste and the REMADE Institute to drive circularity solutions.
green_innovation: TRUE; SEE's investment in advanced recycling technologies and collaboration with partners to develop circular solutions for hard-to-recycle flexible packaging contribute to environmental sustainability goals of reducing waste and resource consumption.
business_innovation: TRUE; SEE's collaboration with ExxonMobil and Ahold Delhaize USA demonstrated the technical, economic, and scalable feasibility of advanced recycling and circular economy business models.
green_product: TRUE; SEE's exploration and investment in advanced recycling technologies that process hard-to-recycle flexible plastics into new food-grade materials contribute to the development of green products.
green_process: TRUE; SEE's involvement in a project with Michigan State University to develop more effective ways to sort and clean contaminated plastic waste contributes to the development of green processes.
product_or_process: Advanced recycling technologies for flexible plastics

title: Apple Arrives on the Scene With Its AI Debut
summary: Apple has finally entered the AI scene with the unveiling of its AI features at its Worldwide Developers Conference. These features aim to make iPhones more personal and convenient, leveraging the phone's knowledge of the user's contacts, messages, and preferences. Apple has also partnered with OpenAI to incorporate ChatGPT into its own AI system, making it available to users without requiring payment.
